InputDirectory.description: Where the inputs of the code will go inside of the specified Data directory

EXAMPLEKEY.description: this key is an example of how this config works, a null value means that the program will ask for your input on the option. You can delete this if you understand the structure

OutputDirectory.description: Where the outputs of the code will go inside of the specified Data directory

DatatableFile.description: The file that specifies the conversion calculation *should be a json file*, normally named: (fontname)datatable.json *overrules font file conversion if set*

IsImageFile.description: Whether the program will be converting an image file or a video file

DisplayTxtFile.description: The text file where precached videos are displayed

DataDirectory.description: Where the working area of the code will be

IsDisplayingPrecached.description: Whether you are loading a video into a file to watch, or generating data

DisplaySpeedFPS.description: The speed at which precached videos are played

BothBrightnesses.description: If the code will calculate both brightnesses *inverted and normal, overrides InvertBrightness*

InvertBrighntess.description: If the code will invert the brightness of the image

InvertedFileOutput.description: The file destination of an inverted file (in the outputs directory)

CreatingDatatable.description: Determines if you are creating the datatable from a font file or using an already made one

FontFile.description: The font file that will be converted to a json file for image translation

NormalFileOutput.description: The file destination of a normal file (in the outputs directory)

DatatableStep.description: The step size that will be calculated for the datatable file if being calculated. Lower results in more accurate but longer time

ImageOrVideoFile.description: The image or video file that will get converted into text
